intro: Impatiens lemuriana, commonly known as the lemurian touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Balsaminaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are borne on slender stems and are pollinated primarily by insects, contributing to its ecological role in supporting local pollinator populations. Impatiens lemuriana is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ease of cultivation in moist, well-drained soils.
